definition: to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
variant of 管[guan3]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
in my humble opinion

sentences.english: The result is a fascinating glimpse into the dark recesses of the German psyche.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果精彩有趣，管窥了德国民族心理的黑暗角落。

sentences.english: Hopefully, this can shed light on the relation between identity and language use.
sentences.chinese: 希望通过这一研究可以管窥身份和语用之间的关系。

sentences.english: Modest Achievements is a summary of Professor Liu Zhengqiang s academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 《管窥蠡测录》是刘正强教授一生学术研究的总结。

sentences.english: The fourth part is a perspective of his charisma;
sentences.chinese: 第四部分管窥高峰的风范。

definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
to find out about/to discover
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
complete picture/full view
to show/to make known
to take a broad view of sth
miniature/scaled-down/forming a microcosm
some cases picked out as example/to highlight
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
to explain/to expound/to interpret/elucidation
evolution of sth over time/course of development/history
